arts.ttl: 'Do fans want to see these given?!' MOTD pundits on Brighton penalty
arts.sum: Match of the Day's Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Danny Murphy discuss the penalty awarded to Brighton & Hove Albion in their 1-1 draw with Arsenal in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta and Fabian Hurzeler react after Premier League statement delivers 'bizarre' verdict
arts.sum: Brighton earn a 1-1 Premier League draw with Arsenal thanks a second half penalty from Joao Pedro.

arts.ttl: 'It is just the difference' - Brighton defenders highlight where game could have been won against Arsenal
arts.sum: Brighton’s Dutch defenders Joel Veltman and Jan Paul van Hecke shared a similar verdict after they starred in a 1-1 draw against title challengers Arsenal.

arts.ttl: 'Hit me' - Joao Pedro weighs in on penalty debate after Brighton earn draw against Arsenal
arts.sum: Joao Pedro feels the officials were correct to award him, and Brighton, a penalty in the 1-1 draw against Arsenal.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta insists he's 'NEVER seen' anything like Joao Pedro's controversial penalty - with the Arsenal boss slamming the 'disappointing' decision which saw points shared with Brighton
arts.sum: ISAAN KHAN: Near the hour mark, Pedro had flicked the ball up and William Saliba, in attempting to head the ball, made contact with the Brazilian's head.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta confirms new Arsenal injury after Brighton draw - 'I think we've lost him'
arts.sum: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has revealed that Ethan Nwaneri picked up a muscle injury after the teenager scored in the Gunners' 1-1 draw with Brighton on Saturday

arts.ttl: Arteta rages at Brighton penalty award: ‘I’ve never seen a decision like this’
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: João Pedro won and scored spot-kick in Arsenal draw ‘When you look, you can see contact there [with the ball]’ Mikel Arteta hit out at Anthony Taylor for awarding the penalty that pegged back Arsenal at Brighton but admitted his side lacked enough “freshness” to hold on for victory. Ethan Nwaneri’s second Premier League goal had given the visitors the lead in the first half but the Arsenal manager was left raging when William Saliba was penalised by Taylor for catching João Pedro in the face as he attempted to head the ball away. “I have never seen a decision like this in my career. I asked the boys if they have and nobody has seen it before,” said Arteta. “When you look at the incident, the distance, the player, João touching the ball, then Saliba touching the ball, you can see contact there. I checked [with the officials]. After three seconds they said they had already checked. It seems quick.” Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Arsenal ratings: Ethan Nwaneri shines but fails to beat Brighton
arts.sum: Ethan Nwaneri was one of the main positives in what was a frustrating performance for Arsenal as they drew Brighton & Hove Albion 1-1 in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Arteta: 'Never seen' decision like Brighton penalty
arts.sum: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said he has "never seen" a decision like the penalty awarded to Brighton in his team's 1-1 draw at the Amex Stadium on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Arsenal and Brighton fans clash over Joao Pedro's controversial penalty as Gunners supporters fume they were 'ROBBED' in 1-1 draw - while Seagulls claim William Saliba could have caused a 'serious head injury'
arts.sum: Arsenal and Brighton fans clashed online over whether Joao Pedro should have been awarded a penalty after being headbutted by William Saliba in Saturday's 1-1 draw.
